content: I forget, are there plans to make const_err a hard error on the next edition?
(cc @rylev who knows everything about lints and errors w.r.t. the edition)

No there was not. I know from experience that I have allowed const_err as a way to get panics in const code. I imagine that there are work arounds to what I was doing, but given that it's not been proposed for 2021 inclusion nor is it completely obvious that this is something we want to do, I'm not sure it's a good candidate for late inclusion.

In general, we'll probably have fewer lint to error upgrades than we may be want, but the plan is to establish a more official lint => error plan so that for the next edition, things are not so ad-hoc.
